column1: Omutninsk (Russian: Омутни́нск) is a town and the administrative center of Omutninsky District in Kirov Oblast
It was first mentioned in 1773; town status was granted to it in 1921.
Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: Omutninsk serves as the administrative center of Omutninsky District. As an administrative division
column5: incorporated within Omutninsky District as the Town of Omutninsk. As a municipal division
column6: the Town of Omutninsk is incorporated within Omutninsky Municipal District as Omutninskoye Urban Settlement.

column1: The Institute of Applied Biochemistry is situated near Omutninsk. According to Dr. Ken Alibek
column3: it was (and possibly still is) a combined pesticide production facility and reserve biological weapons production plant that could be activated in time of war.
